actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

official_title: A resolution to urge the Secretary of Transportation and the Chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board to convene an Airline-Government Summit Conference for the purposes of examining Federal Government policies affecting the airline industry and discussing airlines' fare policies under deregulation

summary.text: Declares that the Senate urges the Secretary of Transportation and the Chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board to organize and cochair an Airline-Government Summit Conference at the earliest practical date. Makes the primary purpose of the conference to undertake a comprehensive review of all major proposals for Federal Government actions or inactions affecting the short and long-term future of the airline industry. Requires that an airline pricing policy meeting be held as part of such conference. Directs the cochairmen to report to the President and the Congress on suggested policy changes resulting from the conference that would assist the airline industry and its users. Urges the Civil Aeronautics Board to grant the conference antitrust immunity within certain limits.
